context.description: The Install Configuration view can be used to work with installed features. Current Configuration shows all features that are currently enabled. By turning the "Show disabled features" button on the toolbar you can see the disabled features as well.

The Feature Updates view can be used to locate new features and feature updates. You can browse predefined site locations, search for updates, browse for updates on your local system, or define your own site bookmarks.
This view is used to present selection details. Its content depends on the current selection.
Results of the feature searches are shown in this view.
This view is used to show the currently selected updates when group updates are used. Several features can be installed or updated at once.
Show details for the selection.
Show disabled features.
Restore your configuration to match the selected history.
Show the current configuration status for the selected feature.
Save the selected configuration in the Saved Configurations folder.
Delete the selected configuration from the Saved Configurations folder.
Unlink the selected site from the configuration.
Display properties for the selection.
Create a new site bookmark.
Create a new folder in the Feature Updates View. Folders can be used to organize site bookmarks and search queries.
Create a new search query.
Create a site bookmark for the selected local site.
Delete the selected item.
Refresh the selected item.
Select to show individual files in My Computer. Deselect to show only local sites and directories.
Select to show only features matching current environment. Deselect to show all available features (features not matching current environment cannot be installed).
Select to see features organized into site categories. Deselect to see all features as a list.
Link the selected site into the configuration.
Display the Update Manager Welcome page.
Go back to the previous details page.
Go forward to the next details page.

Set Update Manager preferences - number of histories to maintain before deleting; scoping of new updates search to service updates only, or compatible minor release updates; update policy to alternate update sites; proxy settings
You must view the presented license agreement(s) and either accept or reject.
Select whether you want to search for available updates to installed features, or to search for any features found on selected update sites

topic.label: Updating features with the update manager

context.description: Enter information to create a new folder. If you are creating a nested folder, specify which folder will be the parent.

Enter information to create a search query. Available Updates query searches for updates based on current configuration. Regular Expressions query searches for features matching specific criteria. Plug-Ins in Features query searches for features containing specified plug-ins.
Enter information to create a new update site bookmark. Select sites to search for features and patches.
Select one or more of the available updates to install.
Select an installation location for the feature from the presented choices, or add a new one.
Select an installation location for the selected feature from the presented choices, or add a new one.
Choose which optional features that are included in the main feature will be installed.
Choose which optional features that are included in the main features will be installed.
You must accept or reject the certificate of the JAR file
Enter user information.
Shows features and patches selected for installing.
Displays details about the selected update site category.
Displays details about features.
Displays details about the "Sites to Visit" folder.
Displays details about a local site that can be linked into the configuration.
Displays details about local site that is part of the configuration.
Displays the details of the current installation configuration.
Displays when an unknown object or no object has been selected in the active part.
Allows browsing of update site information.
Select root paths to include in the search.
Enter the identifier and version of a plugin to search for.
Change properties of the bookmark object.
Change the name of the selected object.
Change the name of the selected configuration.
